author: MINYVONNE BURKE
title: World of Tanks gamer who died was in 'rough shape,' friend says
text:
Popular World of Tanks gamer who died during 24-hour streaming session was in 'rough shape,' friend says World of Tanks gamer who died was in 'rough shape,' friend says NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Saturday, February 25, 2017, 10:09 AM 
Brian Vigneault, a well-known gamer who died during a 24-hour livestream marathon , was reportedly in bad shape before he collapsed in his Virginia Beach home. 
Jessica Gebauer, 29, a friend of Vigneault, told the Associated Press that the 35-year-old father of three didn't look well while playing the popular wargame World of Tanks. 
"He was in rough shape," Gebauer said. "I watched him until about half an hour before he said he'd be right back." 
Gebauer, a fellow video game streamer, said Vigneault looked "really, really tired," so she and other viewers watching him play urged him to get some rest. Brian Vigneault died while playing World of Tanks during a 24-hour streaming session. (Facebook) 
"We were telling him, 'Go to sleep. The stream can wait,' " she told AP. 
Vigneault, who used the online name Poshybrid, died last Sunday while participating in a marathon gaming session, broadcasted via Twitch.tv, for charity. 
Vigneault told viewers that he would play World of Tanks for an entire day to raise money for the Make-A-Wish Foundation. 
However, 22 hours into the session, Vigneault got up for a smoke break and collapsed. Brian Vigneault was using the streaming service Twitch to broadcast his gaming session. (Â© Robert Galbraith / Reuters/REUTERS) 
Virginia Beach police officers responded to a cardiac arrest call at 7:50 p.m. Sunday. Vigneault was pronounced dead at the scene. 
Although Gebauer had concerns about Vigneault during his session, she told AP that she thought her friend took enough breaks to prevent blood clots from forming. 
"I have a hard time believing that streaming for so long was the cause of his death specifically," Gebauer, who's done 24-hour livestreams herself, said. 
"But at the same time, it wasn't good for him," she added. 
A Virginia Department of Health spokeswoman said Vigneault's cause of death is still pending.
